conclusion: To solve the problem, I will analyze the v-t graph to determine the acceleration during the specified interval.

The image is a velocity-time (v-t) graph illustrating the vertical movement of a skydiver. The x-axis represents time (t/s) from 0 to 15 seconds, and the y-axis represents velocity (v/(m·s⁻¹)). The graph shows a parabolic curve starting from the origin, reaching a maximum velocity at 10 seconds, and then decreasing linearly to zero velocity at 15 seconds.

premise: The graph starts at the origin, indicating an initial velocity of zero.
conclusion: As time progresses from 0 to 10 seconds, the graph is a straight line with a positive slope.

premise: A positive slope on a v-t graph indicates an increase in velocity over time, which corresponds to acceleration.
conclusion: The direction of acceleration is given by the slope of the line. Since the slope is positive, the acceleration is upward.

premise: From 10 to 15 seconds, the graph shows a negative slope, indicating a decrease in velocity and thus a downward acceleration.
conclusion: Thus, during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the acceleration is upward.
